authors.author: Frederick W. Faber Henri F. Hemy

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers, living still In spite of dungeon,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines: fire and sword! O how our hearts beat high with joy Whene'er we hear that glorious word!

verse.name: v1c
verse.lines: Faith of our fathers! Holy faith! We will be true to Thee till death!

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
Our fathers, chained in prisons dark,
Were still in heart and conscience free.

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
How sweet would be their children's fate
If they, like them could die for thee!

verse.name: v2c
verse.lines:
Faith of our fathers! Holy faith!
We will be true to Thee till death!

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
Faith of our fathers! God's great power
Shall win all nations unto thee;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
And through the truth that comes from God
Mankind shall then be truly free.

verse.name: v3c
verse.lines:
Faith of our fathers! Holy faith!
We will be true to thee till death!

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
Faith of our fathers we will love
Both friend and foe in all our strife;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
And preach Thee, too, as love knows how,
By kindly words and virtuous life.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
Faith of our fathers we will strive
To win all nations unto Thee!

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
And thro' the truth that comes from God
Mankind shall then be truly free:
